messages.subject: Re: Majordomo having an "episode"
messages.msgSnippet: ... Odd? You really think we d do something odd?  I *finally* made my way back to the real world (where they have computers and stuff) from the bush
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, Fetteroll
<fetteroll@e...> wrote:
> I turned it off. I hope. Mark or Helen must have done something
>odd.

Odd? You really think we'd do something odd? <eg>

I *finally* made my way back to the real world (where they have
computers and stuff) from the bush regions of Alaska, and found
out about this messy little interruption to the list. Wasn't me,
honest! I was waaaay out where the moose and the huskies
roam... <g>

Thanks for dealing with it so quickly, Joyce. I still haven't talked
with Mark enough to know what on earth happened. I'm not even
sure *he* knows.

FYI, I'll be on no-mail for a few days, but will read whenever I can
get to a computer, like now. More later, or tomorrow. Or
sometime soon.

Helen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Majordomo having an "episode"
messages.msgSnippet: ... I do! I turned it off. I hope. Mark or Helen must have done something odd. Joyce Unschooling-dotcom moderator
messages.messageBody:
on 1/15/03 1:12 PM, Vicki A. Dennis at mamaxaos@... wrote:

> Anyone know where the "off" switch is?

I do!

I turned it off. I hope. Mark or Helen must have done something odd.

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.subject: Majordomo having an "episode"
messages.msgSnippet: Is medication required?  Therapy? I have been merrily deleting but am beginning to feel like the Sorcerer s Apprentice.   The more I delete, the more appear.
messages.messageBody:
Is medication required? Therapy?
I have been merrily deleting but am beginning to feel like the Sorcerer's Apprentice. The more I delete, the more appear.
Anyone know where the "off" switch is?

vicki
